intro: Colutea uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower buckthorn, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae) and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Colutea uniflora is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
